name: Sheraton Suites Orlando Airport

reviews.text: Stayed here for a weekend wedding in Orlando area, wanted to be close to airport for early flights and have something comfortable for four people sharing a suite. This Sheraton hit the mark. Hotel is right outside airport proper, with a rent a car and/or shuttle not more than a five minute drive or so. In a hotel complex right off the highway but seperated from highway noise. Surrounding area has plenty of food choices, gas stations, retail needs etc.
reviews.title: Satisfied w/Sheraton

reviews.text: Hotel itself was clean, service was prompt when called (more towels, front desk questions etc). Suite was one bedroom and seperated living area with refer/microwave and desk area. Pull out sofabed was not so bad - slept on worse at other chains. Other beds were comfy - sweet sleepers. Plenty of pillows and extra blankets in suite. Outside sink area is large in bedroom, which makes for ease of sharing space for multiple people sharing one bath. Bathroom itself was small, but good shower. Used the airport shuttle for pick up late one night and was very prompt with nice driver, the next day they weren't prepared for our party and we had to go in seperate trips back to the airport (no big hassle), but this driver certainly was not so cheery (maybe it's the early, early shift and Starbucks doesn't open till 6am at the hotel).
reviews.title: Is this really a Sheraton?

reviews.text: Overall good quality, up to date, well maintained. Workout room was small but certainly adequate - decent equipment (except none of the machines/treadmills/bikes etc face the TV)? Had small bar area and Starbucks coffee within restaurant - but not much selection on a weekend of breakfast muffin/bagels etc to go? Maybe wanted you to stay for the expensive breakfast buffet ($16.95!), which was no different than the freebies you get at Residence Inns, Hampton Inns, or Embassy Suites...definite rip off by Sheraton (but then again most hotel restaurants are just that), but it's there - if you must. Lunch and dinner also served.
reviews.title: Try Another Hotel
Probably my Favorite Orlando Airport Hotel!
reviews.text: For the location - close to airport, highway access to orlando and or Sea World/Universal etc , ma be not a bad choice at $100-120 a night. Certainly clean and comfortable for 3-4 sharing a suite.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed in a number of hotels in different parts of the world, including the USA. I would not stay in this hotel again!
reviews.title: Would stay again

reviews.text: Had stay over after week long cruise and early flight the next morning. Was looking forward to the beds I kept reading about. What a disappointment. The bed was bowed in the middle, my wife and I kept rolling "down the hill: into each other. And the mattress on the pull out wasn't any better. Only advantage was the property was about a mile from MCO.
reviews.title: Bed Was Like a Taco
Love it!
reviews.text: Great place! Airport shuttle was great, two-room suite was comfortable and nice. Staff were friendly and accommodating. Hotel exceeded expectations. Only "problem" was the indoor pool looked dirty, but we didn't have any time to use it anyways. The location is pretty good, too. Close to the airport, and within walking distance to restaurants.

reviews.title: Great stay near the airport
reviews.text: You can't beat a $99 per night rate. The suites are spacious and clean. Front desk staff is very helpful. Skip the shuttle from the airport--they make you wait a long time because they are picking up and dropping off people at local restaurants (I waited 20 minutes then jumped in a cab). If you are impatient like me, spend the $10 take a cab.

Stayed here June 3rd before an early morning flight. Rooms were very clean, bed was comfortable but grandson said the pull out sofa bed was not that comfotable. Everything is very clean. Had a problem w/ the A/C when we entered the room, the hallway was cooler so I set it to the coldest setting and went to have dinner at Fridays. (Don't waste your money here) When we returned to the room it was hotter so I called front desk and w/in 5 minutes they had it fixed and cooling. Pool is very clean but the water was freezing. They have 24hour airport van that runs on the 20's. We went at 0420. The driver was very nice. Will stay here again.
reviews.title: Luxury for less

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived in the beautiful lobby.
reviews.title: Wow.

likes.disliked: — Room Service trays lying in the hall for our entire stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this property on our last day of our motorcycle trip through Florida (May 14th) because of its close proximity to the airport. Overall, it was a nice Sheraton. Although somewhat "dated and worn," she's still a nice property. The free shuttle to the airport and nearby restaurants was a nice touch. The room was very clean and comfortable. The room had a “lounge area,” which was separated from the bedroom and had a small refrigerator and microwave. My only complaint with the room was the overall layout of the bedroom and bathroom area. The shower and toilet were located in a separate room with a door for privacy, which was perfect. However, the sink area was located in the same room adjacent to where the bed was located with no privacy whatsoever. If you're traveling by yourself, this isn't a problem. However, if you're traveling with someone else and they get up to use the sink, there's no privacy whatsoever. My wife is an early riser. So, when she got up and turned on the lights for the sink area, it basically illuminated the entire bedroom area. Whoever designed the room layout clearly tailored it for single travelers.
reviews.title: Not bad for an older Sheraton...

likes.liked: — Close to the airport and free shuttle.
likes.disliked: — The property needs to be updated.

reviews.text: The washer and dryer on the third floor were very useful. However, for a hotel with so many rooms, one washer and dryer were clearly insufficient. The staff was extremely friendly and professional, which made the stay pleasant. If I had to stay at a hotel near Orlando's International Airport, I would probably stay at this property again. However, the property really needs to be updated.
reviews.title: Almost home

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel several times and it always seems like I'm almost home. Checkin is always fast and easy, the lobby is very pleasant, rooms are like one bedroom apartments. Nice living area with sleeper couch and kichette, full bedroom suite attached. Easy access from the airport of crossing the state by car. Quiet rooms and confortable beds, two TV's and a nice pool area. I have not used the restaurant.
reviews.title: Fantastic beds and a Great Room!

reviews.text: Rates are always competitive at around $119/nt. Great for business or family overnights, this however is not a destination for a long vacation, but an excelent airport hotel
reviews.title: wicked room upgrade 4 free

reviews.text: Only bad comment is that the stairwells are not kept as clean as the rest of the hotel.
reviews.title: Good location, bad experience at check in

likes.liked: — Location. Close to Airport and off-site airport rental car lot.
likes.disliked: — Incompetent front desk staff. Being charged twice for one room night.

description: Stay in the middle of the action at the Sheraton Suites Orlando Airport. We are just a mile by complimentary shuttle from Orlando International Airport, available 24 hours a day.
